source.1fd3ae80:
import plotly.express as px

cumsum=0
sums=[]
x_axis=[ 'I have never written code',
  '< 1 years',
  '1-3 years',
  '3-5 years',
  '5-10 years',
  '10-20 years',
  '20+ years']

for i in x_axis:
    cumsum+=round((df["Q6"][1:]==i).sum()/(df["Q6"][1:]==i).count()*100,2)
    sums.append([i,100-cumsum])
    
px.bar(pd.DataFrame(sums,columns=["experience above level","percentage %"]),x="experience above level",y="percentage %",title="Cumulative amount of workers")

source.057142b0:
> COMPANY_NAME is a leading provider of analytics solutions to BUZZWORD brands and retailers in the Nordics. We have over 100 clients including many of the best local BUZZWORD brands and Nordic units of global players. We help our clients to BUZZWORD better by offering BUZZWORD tools for BUZZWORD shoppers and how to best BUZZWORD them.



>Join us to create the best in class SaaS products that will conquer the world! You’ll be valuable member of our Data Science team, responsible for our in-house BUZZWORD. Our products are built by our software teams on top of the Analytics Engine, utilizing features such as forecasts, recommendations, and other optimizations. Everything is served using modern cloud infrastructure, providing our clients with information such as what products to offer, in which stores, and with what kind of promotional activities.



>The Data Science team is a cross-functional Scrum-team of five people, including you. The work is prioritized by our Head of Data Science who acts as a Product Owner for the team. At the moment, the team's main focus is on COMPANY_NAME Promotion solution, which is targeted for COMPANY_NAME brands and which we are currently piloting with the first COUNTRY_NAME customers. The position is based in CITY_NAME where we will have brand new premises starting from MONTH_NAME. Part of the work can be done remotely according to your own preferences and the team's conventions. This job requires a valid work permit to COUNTRY_NAME. 



>Requirements

>Most importantly you have prior experience of similar Data Scientist position(s). Tackling the entire list below is not essential for applying this role.

>Programming and scripting skills: **Python** (Numpy & Pandas), **SQL**, **Git** and Bash.
Data modeling skills: time series, gradient boosted regression trees (e.g. LightGBM) and neural networks (**Keras & Tensorflow**).
Data engineering skills to extract, refine and visualize data. 
Good written and verbal communication skills in English (LANGUAGE_NAME is a plus). You should be able to discuss complex analytical issues with different stakeholders.
Prior experience from the retail industry and its data is beneficial.
Interfaces and cloud: realtime RESTful APIs, **Amazon AWS**, Kubernetes, Docker, Redis and Apache Spark.


>We offer you:

>A key position in a growing company at the forefront of modern technology – an excellent chance to learn and grow professionally even for senior talent
Enthusiastic and innovative R&D department and Data Science team with skilled and motivated talent
Lots of data and data driven tech opportunities
Competitive compensation with extensive health care
An environment with teams that consider the people & spirit to be our best asset


>Interested in the role and believe you would be the person we are looking for? Send us your informal application!

# Finding a needle

### So, we all have been here. Seen some work ads and thought on how realistic their requirements are. This notebook will find out how big portion of Kaggle population will fill the technical requirements of a job.
source.467f3c08: # Let's add all of these together and see how big percentage fills this criteria
source.1db1d37c: We end up having less than **1%** of the population left if we require all of these skills
